displaytitle: Portrait of Su Shi in a Bamboo Hat and Sandals
displaydate: 1845 (stone); late 19th to first half of 20th century (rubbing)
medium: Hanging scroll; ink rubbing on paper
inscribed:
Top, title:
蘇文忠公笠屨圖
“Lord Su Wenzhong [i.e., Su Shi] in a Bamboo Hat and Sandals.”

Top, center:
Han Fengxiang 韓鳳翔 (late Qing dynasty)
天誕坡仙
曰光月皎
名著中年
風傳嶺？ 
由惠？儋
訪黎？道
及館於廉
挽鬚？稿
帽說籐佳
鞋稱芒好
海角天涯
善人同？
	道光乙巳[1845]夏五月  山左韓鳳翔謹賛。
“. . .
	In the 5th month, summer, in the yisi cyclical year of the Daoguang reign, respectfully eulogized by Han Fengxiang of Shandong.”
Notes:
1. “Li” 黎 refers to Su Shi visiting (fang 訪) Li Ziyun 黎子雲 at Danzhou 儋州 when he got caught in the rain.
2. “Haijiao Tianya” 海角天涯 refers to Haijiao Ting 海角亭 and Tianya Ting 天涯亭, two pavilions that are also mentioned in the inscription by Bai Shuangqing 白雙慶 (bottom, right).

Top, left:
[to be transcribed]

Top, right:
Feng Lan 馮蘭 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。順德馮蘭題。 
“. . . inscribed by Feng Lan of Shunde.”
Notes:
1. Shunde 順德 county, Guangdong province. 

2nd from top, 2nd from left:
Lin Shirong 林世榮 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。
燕山[之]巖林世榮謹識。
[to be transcribed] 。。。

2nd from top, left:
Zhang Ming 章銘 (late Qing dynasty)
欽州尉會稽章銘敬題。
“Respectfully inscribed by the Commandant of Qinzhou Zhang Ming from Kuaiji.”

3rd from top, 2nd from left:
Liang Jiong 梁烱 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。
國子監助教南寶梁烱敬題。
“Respectfully inscribed by the Directorate of Education Instructor Liang Jiong from Nanbao.” 

3rd from top, left:
Pan Changyuan 潘暢垣 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。
達三潘暢垣敬題。
“. . . inscribed by Pan Changyuan of Dasan.”

2nd from bottom, 2nd from left:
Li Yusong 李于嵩 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。道光廿五年夏五月前署雲南布
政司經歷李于嵩敬題。
“In summer, the 5th month of the 25th year [1845] of the Daoguang reign...respectfully inscribed by Li Yusong.” 

2nd from bottom, left:
Li Yu[qiong] 李于[瓊] (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。李于[瓊]敬題。
“. . . respectfully inscribed by Li Yu[qiong].”

Bottom, right:
Bai Shuangqing 白雙慶 (late Qing dynasty)
蘇文忠公在儋州訪黎子雲遇雨借農家笠屐畫家傳笠屐圖作褰衣狀及在廉州
詩有芒鞋不踏利名埸白頭穿林要籐帽句畫家又作屨圖海角亭遺像是笠屨非
笠屐也數百年來海角亭有公像天涯亭矣有公像昔公撰潮州韓文公廟碑云公之神
在天下如水在地中無所往而不在吾以為蘇公之神亦無往不在也則勒此像於海角亭
也宜即勒此像於天涯亭也亦宜 
道光乙巳[1845]夏五月榖旦
知欽州事靈山縣知縣長白雙慶敬誌

Bottom 2nd from right:
Gong Gengguang 龔耿光 (late Qing dynasty), native of Minhou 閩侯 county, Fujian province.
[to be transcribed] 。。。
	古閩後學龔耿光謹題。 

Bottom, 3rd from left: 
Lin Chenggan 林成幹 (late Qing dynasty)
安州林成幹繪
“Painted by Lin Chenggan of Anzhou.”
Notes:
1. Anzhou 安州 county, Sichuan province.

Bottom, 2nd from left: 
Zhu Tengxing 朱騰興 (late Qing dynasty)
北龍朱騰興鐫
“Carved by Zhu Tengxing of Beilong.”

Bottom, left:
Li Yuqian 李于岍 (late Qing dynasty)
[to be transcribed] 。。。安州李于岍題。
“. . . inscribed by Li Yuqian from Anzhou.”
Notes:
1. Anzhou 安州 county, Sichuan province.

texts.textentryhtml: Scene illustrating the story of the Song dynasty literatus, statesman, and artist Su Shi 蘇軾 (1036-1101) when he was on the island of Hainan during his second period of exile. Caught in a rainstorm, he borrowed a farmer’s bamboo hat with a broad rim and wood shoes (ji 屐) before continuing on his way, while the villagers laughed at the sight of his outlandish appearance. In this portrait he is shown wearing woven reed or straw sandals (ju 屨).
